comments.author: angela@spinachtiger
comments.content: It's right about now that I move from Christmas flavors and want Asian. And, these I want. Never heard of before, but I know I would love.

comments.author: Jo
comments.content: Looks delicious. Would love for you to share your pictures with us over at foodepix.com.

comments.author: Cowboycountryvegetarian
comments.content:
Hello Michael,
1. I just found your blog and I have to tell your it's amazing! I love it! 
2. Congratulations on a book, I've pre-ordered it through Amazon already. 
3. Recipes are great. This one is something I would make for dinner if I were in Seattle and Uwajimaya was just around the corner. I am going to look for yuba here. Who knows! 
Anyway, I am glad I found your blog for recipes, for inspiration, and for ... piece of Seattle, that I really miss... 
Thanks!

comments.author: amee
comments.content: I have never heard of Yuba.  (not surprising, but I love to come here to learn something!)  H-Mart, here i come.  also what is kochujang, if I may ask?  :)  (i do LOVE the milk skin when making homemade yogurt...growing up, my mom used to slap my hand when I stole the skin of the milk, but now that i'm all grown up, i'm the boss)  :)

comments.author: The Cozy Herbivore
comments.content: I love yuba, and when it's crispy, it's so addictive! This recipe looks great, I can't wait to try it!

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: H Mart will hook you up with both the yuba and the kochujang, which is a Korean soybean and chili paste. Delicious, addictive stuff!

comments.author: Katie
comments.content: I hope this one is easy, it really looks good. I love a good crispy tofu skin :)

comments.author: mitu
comments.content:
do you have recipe for kimchi soup with tofu and veggie.  I always have it at korean restaurant but don't know how to make it.  they usually give it in pot - i believe its called dolsot pot... 
let me know. thank you

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Hey Mitu - Nope, I haven't made that. I'll take it as a suggestion though! Unless you are thinking of kimchi jigae? That one is in my cookbook.
